solution.text:
Let the base angles of the triangle = \(x\) degrees
Vertex angle = _{{2*j}}_ degrees
Thus, according to the Angle-Sum Property of a triangle:
\(x + x + _{{2*j}}_ = 180\)
\(\Rightarrow 2x + _{{2*j}}_ = 180\)
\(\Rightarrow 2x = 180 - _{{2*j}}_\) [Taking all constant terms to one side]
\(\Rightarrow 2x = _{{180-(2*j)}}_\)
Dividing both sides by 2:
\(x = _{{90-j}}_\)
Therefore, the 2 base angles measure _{{90-j}}_ degrees each.
